page.title: 02MANOR HOUSE FARM:Upland Farm
page.content: The farm comprises 740 acres including 300 acres rough grazing and 340 acres reclaimed pasture.Stock includes 250 mainly Charolais heifers which produce good meat and suit upland pasture;550 breeding ewes and 1000 store lambs to fatten annually,mainly Swaledale and East Lonks.Beef cattle are mainly bought in Wales,whilst sheep are bred on the farm.Fat lambs are sold all year round at Bentham and beef cattle at Preston.Cattle graze outside from mid-May to mid-October.100 acres provide 1 silage crop per year.It is clamp-stored.Preston Farmers supply barley,fish-meal and proven for winter feed.Hay is bought.Cattle are cubicle fed in winter 30 per building, according to weight.The farmer and 1 labourer work the farm.
